abstract: Sub-atomic particles called neutrinos have achieved pop-culture status since group of Italian physicists claimed to have observed them exceeding speed of light, cosmic 'speed limit' set down by Albert Einstein; jokes, songs and even Youtube parodies have proliferated since findings were made public.
snippet: Neutrinos are achieving a sort of pop culture fame.
lead_paragraph: Neutrinos are achieving a sort of pop culture fame.

headline.main: Particles Faster Than the Speed of Light? Not So Fast, Some Say
headline.print_headline: Particles Faster Than the Speed of Light? Not So Fast, Some Say
headline.seo: Neutrinos Find a Place in Debate and in Pop Culture
